intro: Hieracium perlepidum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green to white ray florets, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium perlepidum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
